meanings.definition: Abnormal development or growth of cells
meanings.sent1: The doctor explained that dysplasia can lead to serious health issues.
meanings.sent2: The lab report showed dysplasia in the cell samples.
meanings.sent3: The dysplasia in the cells made them look like tiny puzzles under the microscope.
meanings.sent4: Her garden, with its dysplasia of flowers, resembled a chaotic painting.
meanings.sent5: The dysplasia of the cells was like a tangled web, difficult to unravel.

meanings.definition: A condition where cells appear abnormal under a microscope
meanings.sent1: The scientist studied the dysplasia of the cells closely.
meanings.sent2: Under the microscope, the dysplasia was clearly visible.
meanings.sent3: The dysplasia of the cells seemed to give them each a unique personality.
meanings.sent4: The dysplasia in the cells was like a secret code waiting to be deciphered.
meanings.sent5: The dysplasia under the microscope looked like a tiny, twisted forest.

meanings.definition: An abnormality in the development of tissues or organs
meanings.sent1: The dysplasia in the organ was causing health problems.
meanings.sent2: The tissues showed signs of dysplasia during the examination.
meanings.sent3: The dysplasia in the tissues made them resemble a jumbled mess.
meanings.sent4: The dysplasia in the organ was like a roadblock to proper function.
meanings.sent5: The dysplasia of the tissues was a puzzle the doctors needed to solve.
